hey dudes,

if you have problem with the greyed-out launcher it's because there is no registry entry for Oblivion (since you didn't really install it)

copy the following into notepad, change "installed path" to wherever you installed it, save as "oblivion.reg", and run it to add to the registry.

copy here>>
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Bethesda Softworks]

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Bethesda Softworks\Oblivion]
"Installed Path"="C:\\Program Files\\Oblivion\\"

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Bethesda Softworks\Oblivion\1.00.0000]

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Bethesda Softworks\Oblivion - Construction Set]

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Bethesda Softworks\Oblivion - Construction Set\1.00.0000]

Works perfectly! Great stuff!

For those of you with greyed out links - the Launcher cannot find the game because of missing registery keys.
Just follow the uber-easy free instructions (to the letter - no changing location regardless of where your game is actually situated) here and in less than five minutes it is all enabled!
http://www.techspot.com/vb/topic52317.html

Easier than pushing over an old lady! ;D

the reason all the options are grayed out is because the game isnt technically installed on the system, to work around this (if the registry edits dont work, or you dont want to mess with the registry) download the "oblivion mod manager" avalibe here

http://www.tesnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=2097

that will allow you to start the game, and also work with the mods, even allowing you to load some you might not have before!
